channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Whatever happened to ... the Bolivian women who skateboard in Indigenous garb?
item.description: Skateboarding women of Bolivia wear Indigenous garb to pay homage to the strength of their mothers and grandmothers. Their motto: When you fall, you have the power to get back up.
item.content:encoded:
Skateboarding women of Bolivia wear Indigenous garb to pay homage to the strength of their mothers and grandmothers. Their motto: When you fall, you have the power to get back up.

(Image credit: Ben de la Cruz/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Christina Noriega

item.title: The labor movement could prove pivotal this election year
item.description: Younger generations are bringing fresh strategies to the U.S. labor movement. They could prove pivotal for the candidate who harnesses that energy.
item.content:encoded:
Younger generations are bringing fresh strategies to the U.S. labor movement. They could prove pivotal for the candidate who harnesses that energy.

(Image credit: Bill Pugliano)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: This metabolic brain boost revives memory in Alzheimer’s mice
item.description: An experimental cancer drug that helps the brain turn glucose into energy was able to reverse memory loss in a mouse model of Alzheimer’s disease.
item.content:encoded:
An experimental cancer drug that helps the brain turn glucose into energy was able to reverse memory loss in a mouse model of Alzheimer’s disease.

(Image credit: PM Images)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: 5 takeaways from Germany's regional elections after far-right makes historic gains
item.description: The Alternative for Germany party made huge gains in two eastern states, handing the German far-right its best results since World War II.
item.content:encoded:
The Alternative for Germany party made huge gains in two eastern states, handing the German far-right its best results since World War II.

(Image credit: Markus Schreiber)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: 'I got you, girl': A toll collector's unexpected reply to a driver's tears
item.description: When the toll collector asked Leahruth Jemilo how she was doing, she burst into tears. The collector's response has stayed with her ever since.
item.content:encoded:
When the toll collector asked Leahruth Jemilo how she was doing, she burst into tears. The collector's response has stayed with her ever since.

(Image credit: Leahruth Jemilo)
item.dc:creator: Laura Kwerel

item.title: Hear what the nation's top student podcasters have to say
item.description: In its sixth year, our contest handed over the mic to fourth graders for the very first time. We received nearly 2,000 entries from all around the country — and we've narrowed it down to 10 middle school and 10 high school finalists.
item.content:encoded: In its sixth year, our contest handed over the mic to fourth graders for the very first time. We received nearly 2,000 entries from all around the country — and we've narrowed it down to 10 middle school and 10 high school finalists.
item.dc:creator: Janet W. Lee

item.title: Wheelies look fun, but they're a serious skill for kids in wheelchairs
item.description: It takes skill and practice to navigate the world in a wheelchair. This summer program teaches kids how, one wheelie at a time.
item.content:encoded:
It takes skill and practice to navigate the world in a wheelchair. This summer program teaches kids how, one wheelie at a time.

(Image credit: Elizabeth Gabriel)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Gabriel

item.title: General strike in Israel over hostages leads to uneven closures
item.description: A call for a general strike in Israel to protest the failure to return hostages held in Gaza led to closures and other disruptions, but it was ignored in some areas, reflecting political divisions.
item.content:encoded:
A call for a general strike in Israel to protest the failure to return hostages held in Gaza led to closures and other disruptions, but it was ignored in some areas, reflecting political divisions.

(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The Darker Side of the Allies' D-Day Victory in France
item.description: In the summer of 1944, as American and Allied soldiers celebrated the liberation of France from the Nazis, one French family experienced a trauma that would be felt for generations. A murder and sexual assault so traumatic they are only now coming to terms with it, 80 years later. And this wasn't an isolated incident. We hear their story.
item.content:encoded: In the summer of 1944, as American and Allied soldiers celebrated the liberation of France from the Nazis, one French family experienced a trauma that would be felt for generations. A murder and sexual assault so traumatic they are only now coming to terms with it, 80 years later. And this wasn't an isolated incident. We hear their story.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Russia fires a barrage of drones and missiles at Kyiv as children return to school
item.description: Russia launched a barrage of drones, cruise and ballistic missiles at Kyiv, Ukraine's air force said early Monday, sending residents into bomb shelters.
item.content:encoded:
Russia launched a barrage of drones, cruise and ballistic missiles at Kyiv, Ukraine's air force said early Monday, sending residents into bomb shelters.

(Image credit: Vasilisa Stepanenko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
